de.jannlab.core

Class Link

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.jannlab.core.Link

  • public final class Link
extends Object
    This class provides constants and static methods for handling links and arrays of links. A link consists of a 3-tuple (i,j,k) where i gives a source index, j gives a destination index and k gives a weight index.

    All links of a ANN are contained by a large 1-dimensional int-array. This is to improve the runtime performance by supporting the system's caching mechanisms: A multidimensional array could be theoretically distributed over the whole memory. Having all links in one int-array aligned corresponding to the computation order of the network highly allows the benefit from caching (memory burst). For this it is recommend to enable JIT of the JVM.

    The code of the two merge sort implementations is largely redundant. But a particular implementation for links with a static compare function improves the runtime performance in comparison with the native sorting methods which needs a comparator object.

    Author:
    Sebastian Otte

    • Method Detail

      • link

        public static int[] link(int src,
         int dst)
        Creates a non weighted link from src to dst as int[3]. In a non weighted link the weight index is set to NOWEIGHT.
        Parameters:
        src - Source index.
        dst - Destination index.
        Returns:
        Non weighted link.

      • link

        public static int[] link(int src,
         int dst,
         int widx)
        Creates a weighted link from src to dst with weight widx as int[3].
        Parameters:
        src - Source index.
        dst - Destination index.
        widx - Weight index.
        Returns:
        Weighted link.

            int first,
            int second)
        Compares two links in dst-major order.

        first - The first link.
        second - The second link.
        Returns:
        SMALLER, BIGGER or EQUAL.

        Returns:
        true or false.

      • sortDstMaj

        public static void sortDstMaj(int[] src,
              int[] dst,
              int low,
              int high,
              int order)
        Adaption of fast merge sort algorithm from http://www.java2s.com/Code/Java/Collections-Data-Structure/FastMergeSort.htm which uses insertion sort for smaller arrays. Sorting in dst-major order.

        Parameters:
        src - Unsorted data as int[].
        dst - Result data as int[].
        low - Lower bound of data frame.
        high - Exclusive upper bound of data frame.
        order - ORDER_ASC or ORDER_DESC for ascending respectively descending order.

      • sortSrcMaj

        public static void sortSrcMaj(int[] src,
              int[] dst,
              int low,
              int high,
              int order)
        Adaption of fast merge sort algorithm from http://www.java2s.com/Code/Java/Collections-Data-Structure/FastMergeSort.htm which uses insertion sort for smaller arrays. Sorting in src-major order.

        Parameters:
        src - Unsorted data as int[].
        dst - Result data as int[].
        low - Lower bound of data frame.
        high - Exclusive upper bound of data frame.
        order - ORDER_ASC or ORDER_DESC for ascending respectively descending order.

        Copy link from source array to destination array.
        Parameters:

        dst - Destination array of links.
        dstoff - Destination link offset.

        order - ORDER_ASC or ORDER_DESC for ascending respectively descending order.

        Returns:

      • asString

        public static String asString(int[] links,
              int off,
              int num)
        Builds a string for a given range of links. The resulting string is just one single text line.

        Parameters:
        links - The links.
        off - The offset of the links range.
        num - The number of links.
        Returns:
        String representation of the link range.

      • asString

        public static String asString(int[] links,
              int off,
              int num,
              int numbreak)
        Builds a string for a given range of links. The resulting string contains of multiple lines. A line break is set after every numbreak links.

        Parameters:
        links - The links.
        off - The offset of the links range.
        num - The number of links.
        numbreak - Number of links per text line.
        Returns:
        String representation of the link range.
